alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Hall; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:14AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern King, Childress, northeastern Motley, Cottle, southeastern Hall and northeastern Stonewall Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 514 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Northfield to 9 miles west of Rochester. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Childress, Paducah, Cee Vee, Kirkland, Swearingen, Grow, Tell, Delwin, Old Glory, Chalk, Hackberry, Estelline and Us- 380 Near The Haskell-Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Childress; Cottle; Hall; King; Motley; Stonewall
